item.title: Pandora
item.description: In some of the Yggdrasil Outposts, there are a wall of lockers with two doors in each. One side faces a ‚Äúlocker room‚Äù where someone with a key code (or wallet signature) is able to unlock a locker and retrieve its contents.

item.title: Helios
item.description: ‚ÄúHalf‚Äù of the transport system managed by Leviathan is a network of drivers moving parcels between holding stations. Holding stations may be lockers or human-managed locations.

item.title: Leviathan
item.description: The goal is to abolish traditional physical goods markets in favor of a ‚Äúfractured market‚Äù where the goods are held jointly by storage locations and transport media ...

item.title: Silver Outpost ‚Ññ1
item.description: The front of the location is couches where dealings may be done, or clients can rent a couch for an extended stay. There is one couch reserved for the Monitor who is on site to safeguard everything and help the guests with anything they might want.

item.title: Yggdrasil
item.description: Yggdrasil is a system for managing short term leases on specific locations targeted down to the level of a single room, or even piece of furniture. It also helps manage the user reputations within the game.

item.title: Gaianism
item.description: One of the goals of the revolution is to supplant the Judaistic religions with one grounded in science. Basic Cencepts One of the founding tenets of fundamentalist Christianity is that a virgin got pregnant.

item.title: Pantheon
item.description: The Pantheon is a set of related applications that work together to support the revolution. [Mobs](Serial Mobbing): The process by which the systems are coded.

item.title: Why It's Called That
item.description: The Technoanarchist Revolution is a speculative science fiction story by Œ¥œÖœÇ. It describes the transition from the existing world history to a society without war, homelessness, or systemic hunger.
